definition: an artist's brush
an artist's individual skill or style
an implement for writing, drawing, or marking consisting of or containing a slender cylinder or strip of a solid marking substance
a small medicated or cosmetic roll or stick for local applications

a set of geometric objects each pair of which has a common property                                      
             
             the lines in a plane through a point comprise a pencil of lines
something (such as a beam of radiation) long and thin like a pencil
to paint, draw, write, or mark with a pencil

to plan or designate tentatively                                      
                
                  —used with in          penciled him in as the nominee
an instrument used for writing and drawing that has a hard outer part and a black or colored center part
to draw or write (something) with a pencil
a device for writing or drawing consisting of a stick of black or colored material enclosed in wood, plastic, or metal
to write, mark, or draw with a pencil

a small medicated or cosmetic roll or stick for local applications                                      
             
             a menthol pencil
an aggregate of rays of radiation (as light) especially when diverging from or converging to a point
in: the lines in a plane through a point comprise a pencil of lines
penciled him in as the nominee
Use a pencil instead of a pen so you can erase your mistakes.
He penciled some notes on a piece of paper.
a menthol pencil

definition: a long thin object, usually made of wood, that you use for writing or drawing by pressing the black or coloured part in its centre against paper or some other surface
the substance inside a pencil, used for writing or drawing
in: a coloured pencil
Your pencils need to be sharpened.
Use pencil to draw the diagram.
She had scribbled his name in pencil.

the form of some types of make-up:
a thin beam of light:
used to describe something that has been drawn with a pencil:
to write something with a pencil
a thin, usually wooden, tube-shaped device for writing or drawing which has colored material in the center and a point at one end:
in: a box of coloured pencils
pens and pencils
He sat with his pencil poised, ready to take notes.
The pencil's blunt - you'd better sharpen it (= make its point sharp).

a pencil sharpener
an eyebrow pencil
a lip pencil

pencil sketches/drawings

colored pencils
